title: The vocal effects of Daft Punk
summary: The article discusses the vocal effects used in Daft Punk's music, specifically in the album "Human After All." The author, qzervaas, spent years researching and collecting music gear to create these effects. They emailed Imogen Heap, the singer of the song "Hide and Seek," and were able to confirm the exact harmonizer used in the song. The article argues that "Human After All" is not well-received by most music experts, but it is an important part of the evolution of electronic music. The author also discusses the impact of Daft Punk on the music industry and their influence on other artists.
